review: I wanted to give 1 star to this location, but since the food, when you finally get it, when they finally bring you what you ordered, the way you ordered it, and after they sit everybody at a table that arrived after you did, tastes good. I've had nothing but bad experiences at this ONE location of CPK - no idea why.

Good for kids, but not if you're a kid yourself. We're high school students and they ignored us for 10 minutes. The guy who took our order was disorderly and dripped sweat on our table, and we had to wait for a good 10 minutes before being able to flag someone down. Oh yeah, and thanks for the nonexistent bread that was given to us. My friend's drink was taken away from friend, presumably to be refilled, but it was never given back... it took them 25 minutes just to take out the bread, and then 30 minutes to get mediocre food. I just don't think I'm ever going to come here again, and I don't suggest that you do, either
Love this no matter what location for a quick family lunch or dinner.  Love the Chicken Piccata and how they always are developing new dishes and ask your opinion.

I love this place. They have great food, and great service. They are very friendly here. I love their cheese pizza, salad, tortilla soup, and macaroni and cheese. The only complaint that I have is that their bread should be heated. Otherwise this place is great!

Yeah, this branch has better quality than some of them (like Westwood-bleh!!) But they get a few points docked on my account for really slow service. What is that all about? And, they didn't quite clear all the plates before serving dessert. Phew. Nasty. But, I shouldn't be too harsh on them. They were quite nice and went with the flow of our big group. Props to them for that. And, again, the food was rather good. Mind you, I note differences in food quality between different branches of the same chain. All in all, a mediocre to pleasant experience.

The location requires parking in the underground lot.  CPK offers some unusual pizza selections (like BBQed chicken pizza) and delicious soups and salads.  Their focaccia with checca (chopped tomatoes) is tasty and filling.  Their lemonade is decent. Vegan Report: Their vegetarian Smashed Pea and Barley soup is awesome. I also love the Thai Linguini without chicken and the Thai Crunch Salad without chicken. There is a good deal to choose from.

Ok, been to this and other cpk's several times. Meh.  The pizza is over salted most of the time and sometimes even comes out a little undercooked.  You get a decent amount of pizza for an individual size, but it's definitely not enough to share a single one.  I've had service issues at this one, but generally it's ok.   The bread and ice-cold packets of butter they bring out are awful, and the only reason I eat it is because when the place is busy it takes a while to get some food out.   I havn't found an appetizer I enjoy besides the Spinach Artichoke dip (which isn't bad).   I'm pretty particular about pasta, so I'll just say CPK's pasta dishes did not make the cut.   If you go here, get pizza and pizza only.  I'd still suggest going elsewhere for that.

Damn, I hate doing this. Don't get me wrong, I love CPK. The bbq chicken pizza rocks and my mouth waters for it everytime, but I had to wait 10 minutes to get my drink order in and another 10 minutes to get my drink. Now thats 20 minutes I waited without ordering my bbq chicken pizza which made my stomach angry. Now, when my stomach gets angry, no one can appease him, except a bbq chicken pizza that is ready to eat. At this point I'm even getting angry, and I'm usually a cool guy. This is where I exit and go to Sansai across the street. You suck Brentwood CPK.
Can't go wrong with CPK.  And they have online ordering.  Cheap parking.  Entrance just before the bus stop at Barrington on Vicente.

been going here for many years. i have always had a great experience, scott has always helped my family and i every time we eat there. all staff has been friendly and courteous. the mango iced tea is delicious. parking is conveniently located with validation required. food has always been on time, warm, and great. highly recommend this cpk.

Powerful Jambalaya, the way it's supposed to be served: hot and spicy with chunky meat, chicken and shrimp. The noodles were excellently prepared. My girlfriend had a vegetarian pizza and it was just outstanding as well. The decoration was so nice I wanted to have the dining room as my own.

I admit it...CPK is my guilty pleasure.  It's a chain, it has a consistent, corporate feel between stores that is diametrically opposed to the quirky one-off restaurants I often frequent, but I like it. I've frequented many locations, but the Brentwood store is closest to my office and is my current favorite.  And as consistent as they try to be, some crews are just better than others, and the Brentwood crew is one of the best.  The counter is anchored during the day by Johnny, who always remembers my very customized pizza and keeps my glass refilled.  If he did this just for me I'd be impressed, but he always seems to have a counter full of regulars who appreciate his excellent service as much as I do. I'm not going to help you out much with the food here.  It is a pretty simple concept with a wide variety of tasty, consistent dishes.  I like the Japanese Eggplant pizza but my favorite is the Tostada pizza (with Serrano peppers added.)  You won't miss with the food, but I appreciate the excellent service and the somehow the ambient noise is the perfect background for reading a magazine over lunch.  Extra points for a willingness to customize orders without complaint, and a terrific attitude about redos if they goof. BTW, I always find a place to park on the street....

CPK is a good place to go with the family because there is something for everyone here.  Of course they have a variety of pizzas, but they also have salads (along with delicious salad pizzas), sandwiches, and pasta dishes.  The parking is rough at this location, but what else can you expect from the west side of town.  The food is definitely worth it.  It is so hard to find what you want because you want everything.  They also have a bunch of appetizers that compliment the meal nicely.
excellent pizza's and salads. we just love CPK

First visit glass of red wine, Mojito and fish tacos,(love them) don't have in Nashville.  Nice mood for a chilled Cali winter, The fish tacos were good had to scrape the crap off the top, I'm a meat Man just love to taste my food. The mixture of bean and salsa dip was aw-some.  My Hats off to the Heat lamps I mean my beanie off to them .  Come with me..... Sitting there with a beautiful lady, drinking wine, eating fish (favorite) and taking your beanie off and the heat from the gas lamp on my sexy bald head.  oooooh.oooh! this feels so good and relaxing. It feels like a pretty lady massaging your head while you eat what a sexy way to eat tacos (now fix me my tacos) ..(Scene from movie Baby Boy after sex) ..never mind  Great experience you have to try it ...... :)

Terrible food, horrible service. We stood in the front for about 10 minutes until a waiter finally got the attention of the hostess busy flirting with another waiter. Our waiter was too lazy to walk around the little half wall to take or orders or even hand us our drinks. The food was disgusting. I ordered a simple cheese pizza. It arrived with so much grease on it, that the grease flowed off the pizza, over the edge of the plate and all over the table. My fiance's pasta had a literal string in it. We sent back the food and walked out.

First time ordering curbside.  The pizzas were ready to go.  Service was EXCELLENT - on the phone, on the computer, curbside!  The person helping me (sorry I didn't catch your name) was super nice and efficient. Pizza smells wonderful - but I have to save it for the kids.  Big Shoutout to CPK for creating a GF pizza in a certified GF kitchen.  Thank you CPK!
Curbside service is slower than eating at a table.  Routinely takes 10-20 min for them to carry your food down to you.

I used to LOVE CPK. This location always has a weird staff that puts me off for some reason. Its usually empty but takes forever to get water, bread, food, bill. The food is ok. I like the BBQ chicken pizza and Sedona Soup.

Even though I live in an area where there are so many unique restaurants around town... I'm not a restaurant chain snob... I actually like CPK!  They're good! I like their carne asada and Hawaiian pizzas - their crust is so good, their mushroom ravioli - you'll have stinky garlic breath for days - but whatever, spinach dip, their spring rolls and all their desserts.  For what you get, they're affordable! At this location - it's on the second floor of a plaza and has a patio with heaters.  It's always crowded.  $2 parking with validation - I think for 2 hours or so.

I love CPK.  Great food, you know what you are getting. This CPK has THE WORST service.  I am glad I am not the only person with this complaint on here...but seriously, it has gone from decent to bad to horrible.  I wouldn't think it is possible to have so many awful servers all in one place, but they have taken the cake.   In one visit, all of the below actually happened:  - Waited to be seated while the hostess was busy chit chatting with one of the servers.  - Once seated, no server came over for over 5 minutes - I ordered tea...brought hot water, no tea bag.  By the time I got my tea bag, the water was cold.  - Had appetizers, waiter came to take our order and bring more water (only because we had to ask) - didn't think to clear the dirty plates.  - We watched as our food sat on the counter for AT LEAST 5 minutes...finally the "chef" brought it over...it was cold.  - I tried to get our waiter's attention as she was chatting with the "chef/manager" and several other useless servers...no luck.  Finally the "chef" comes over and asks "What's the problem??"  - My order was incorrect - I told the "chef" who had brought it over (since our server was nowhere to be found) and her  response with heavy attitude: "well, I just made it how it was entered in the computer."   - My boyfriend told her how his pizza was completely cold and instead of asking if they could make a new one or even simply apologizing, she sighed and said "well, I could heat it up for you if that's a problem."   - We all asked for an additional round of drinks...10 minutes later, drinks arrive...she walks away without taking all of the empty glasses.  - The bill was incorrect - Waiter & "chef/manager" continued to whisper and stare until we left.   And no, it was not busy at all.   Maybe 6 seated table and at least 3-4 servers.  So there is NO excuse.  Someone needs to look into the hiring decisions ASAP.

I went here for lunch since it's one of the restaurants in had not tried in the area. I ordered the habanero carnitas pizza. I was skeptical about how the pizza would taste, but I actually enjoyed it and would order again. Great customer service and food tasted great.
Just okay. Either CPK used to be better, or my tastes have changed. It wasn't BAD, it just wasn't GREAT. The service was good, though.

Manager was very helpful in pointing this out: When placing pickup orders, press option 3 so you can speak with store instead of national hotline. If you do this, the store people are a TON more helpful. I like the food and Im happy the manager clarified this, he was extraordinarily great and helpful.

CPK is my child's favorite place to dine.  Their split pea soup and cold tiramisu desert are great hits with her.  They will also provide side dishes not on the menu, such as stir-fried mushrooms and garnish olives, for her picky appetite.  We love the friendliness of the staff, valet validation option, and personable manager.  We are picky eaters and very aware of oil quality, and have appreciate CPK's use of healthier  choice of ingredients (never had digestion issues eating there, yet). However, reduction of salt in their soups and other foods would be a very nice improvement.  Another improvement would be more selection of healthy and simple salads and bistro-type options on their appetizer menu (not the main meal menu), especially for the carb-conscious, and an adjustment in the high acidity of their salad dressings (that really matters).    Any remote town we're visiting, we look for CPK branches as a sure bet for decent quality meal that won't upset our stomach and would appease the kids as well.  It would also be nice to see this restaurant make available more local selections, drawing from local produce.  Those always seem to taste the best.

Since CPK is a chain, the food is pretty standard across the board and yummy, so this review would be more about the location. This is in a great area of town with lots of restaurants, shopping, celebrity sightings. The only problem is parking. If you are really lucky you will find meter parking. If you don't mind walking a few blocks, you might find parking in the residential areas. Most likely you will park in the underground garage where they valet your car and charge you about $2 with validation for the time it takes to eat a meal.  This CPK is on the 2nd floor of the building and is very small compared to other CPKs. It has a very cozy feel to it. On a weeknight, there was no wait to be seated, so I guess the size works for this location. The staff was attentive and service was quick.  My only comment about the food: We had asked for 2 salads with dressing on the side; however, only 1 salad had that order followed. The other salad was already tossed w/the dressing.  Overall 3.5 stars. -1 for inconvenient parking, -0.5 for dressing on salad.

Two stars is problably appropriate.  Salad was so-so.  Their BBQ chicken salad used to be decent -- what I had the other day was kind of meh.  It needed extra BBQ sauce to be decent enough to actually eat. I must have been out of my mind, because I decided to order a fruit smoothie.  The smoothie was not worth drinking, and didn't actually have any fruit in it.  Fruit to CPK apparently means some sort of flavoring liquid with the name of a fruit on it's label that's poured into the drink you order.  Even Red Robin puts actual fruit in their drinks. After having not more than the top 1/4 inch of it, I pushed it away.  Later on in the meal the server made the mistake of asking us if we needed anything.  I told him I needed him to take the smoothie away and throw it in the trash. The GF and our guest both had pizzas, which apparently were OK but nothing spectacular.  Dessert, a chocolate something or other was pretty good. Unlike what others have said here, our service here was fine, and the waiter and staff were decently attentive even though the place was crowded and full.

This particular CPK is not as good as the one in Northridge (Fashion Cinema mall)  in terms of ambience and parking. Parking is valet so it is not free unless you want to park across the street and walk across. The inside is a little dark and booths are scarce. Service is average, but food quality is as good as any CPK. I think this place is more for small groups, rather than large families.

Totally decently good! I wouldn't say this location has the best environment somehow...it just feels really small. But, I haven't had a bad experience there and they had my pizza ready for pick up right on time!

Pretty good pizza considerin it's chain. I love their thin crust. I like the fact that it's nice and clean and can always expect the same taste no matter which CPK I go to. The wait is pretty long on weekends but not too bad during the weekdays.  Only thing I don't like too much is that the beer selection is terrible.

First time at this location and the service was slow and not focused on customers.  Food was what you would expect from CPK.  As much as one is charged for iced tea,  we should not have to ask the server for a refill.  Even the condiments we have to ask for, like the red pepper flakes and parmesan cheese that comes in a cheap looking container.  Heck, Costco cheese even taste better and fresher.
I must say, the best location for CPK! I am here at least 3 times a month.  There is only one server that really takes care of me and my family every time we go

My wife and I get their take-out every so often and we love how quickly their service gets our food ready and how polite and accommodating they can be. Highly recommend the BBQ Applewood Smoked Bacon, Waldorf Salad, and Tequila Lime Chicken Fettucini. Their answer to the Korean taco craze is alright, it takes the craving away if you don't want to sit and wait in line at a truck.

This CPK is smaller than the other CPK's that i've been to in Cerritos and Torrance but it has a view that those other two does not have, but only because it is on the second floor with shopping downstairs. This place seems to be less crowded as well or at least the day that I went.  Had their shrimp pizza, jambalaya, and banana chocolate cake. I would say that it was a good combination of things. They can do a half and half on their pizzas as long as it uses the same base sauces at no extra cost. If you want a half and half with different sauces then they charge you extra.  The service was prompt and our server was nice. The other good thing about this meal was that we used a gift card our boss gave us as Christmas presents but none of his employees have used it yet. So the meal was essentially free, but not really since there is no such thing as a free meal...lol...business school...

We ordered takeout for a get-together on Sunday September 20, 2015.  We picked up the food at approximately 12:00pm.  We got 2 pizzas: one BBQ chicken pizza and one salmonella pizza.  The salmonella pie gave both ends of my digestive tract a good workout.  I don't expect any compensation from these wankers, but I will be sending them a bill for the extra toilet paper and the Preparation H I had to buy. I will never eat here again...apparently their employees don't wash their hands after they defecate.

GOD THIS PLACE BLOWS. It's my fault for thinking their service could change. Honestly, never again. This isn't my first lousy interaction with this location but this is the one I'll review as I'm sitting here fuming over their stupidity.  I ordered a dessert to go. One dessert. One simple dessert. Not only did it take way longer than estimated (Give me one minute.... Oh you're still waiting, let me go check.... Oh the dessert. One minute, I'll go get it.) I finally leave with the dessert only to discover it's been made incorrectly. How hard is it to make a dessert when you have the instructions right in front of you? Apparently, it's impossible.  Again, my fault for thinking this time (even a carry out order!) would be any different than my last few experiences. CPK Brentwood, you and I are DONE!   That is all.
OK food. But very rude staff. The waitress was nervous and pissed off. Who would like this kind of attitude?

Worst service ever! The hostess acted like she had no idea what she was doing. We had been sitting for 30 minutes and the server never brought us our drinks. Once we ordered our food and specified what we wanted as an appetizer and what we want for an entree , they messed up the order.

If there are 9 empty tables, then the restaurant is not "full. So do not tell customers that the reason they can't be seated is the restaurant is full. The lies...come on Brentwood.  Food is just like any other CPKs.

Few things in life are guaranteed - we all know this. Taxes? Yeah, sure. Death? Blah, blah, heard that one before. CPK always giving me quality, comfort, affordability, and allowing my tastebuds to gracefully waltz across my tongue? Everyone can agree. To those whimpering about the lack of a true authentic Italian experience, why don't you go snort another line of parmesan cheese. CPK is church. CPK is my refuge. CPK is the rolling hills of south Tuscany on a late summer evening.  I love you CPK. Send these posers giving you a poor rating back to Sbarro.

Whatever you do, don't order a salad at CPK. Stick with pizza and pasta or you'll end up with so much regret. Trust me, I know.  My half salad was SO pathetic as were the other salads i observed at my table. Barely any toppings or chicken. I just think if you're going to order a salad, it better be loaded with goodies.  I don't think I need to write a detailed review of the food at a chain restaurant but if you've never had CPK in your life and are curious as to what's good, you can't go wrong with the chicken tequila fettucine or the original bbq chicken pizza.   As for this CPK location, it's located on the second floor of the interesting looking plaza on San Vicente and Barrington. There's outdoor seating which is always nice and appreciated in sunny LA. Service for our large group was great. Reservations not taken but they'll "take down your name" if you call in. They validate for the valet only parking - which means you still have to pay- you just pay a less exorbitant fee.

Since the food here is pretty standard as far as California Pizza Kitchens go, I am going to focus my review on the specific location and the service at this CPK. Although I have been to this location a number of times in my life, I haven't been in a quite some time.  We came in for a late dinner around 9:30pm. Parking was incredibly simple. The parking garage downstairs was quick and very easy. And, since it was so late, we didn't even get charged to park down there.  We had a tough time deciding what exactly it was that we wanted to eat, but our server Tyree was very patient, friendly, and helpful with suggestions. We ordered the split pea and barley soup, a barbecue chicken pizza, and a quinoa- arugula salad, which were all reasonably good. He was very attentive to our table and made sure that we had everything we needed including bread and some olive oil while we waited.   California Pizza Kitchen has definitely become a little bit more upscale over the years.  The night we were there, CPK was even offering a rib-eye steak entree as well as a grilled halibut entree.  We didn't order these, but it is nice to see the menu opening up further.  Overall, the experience was great. It was a quick, easy dinner with some solid service. I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

This evening at approximately 8:30 I walked in and ordered a salad to go.  I returned after walking around the mall a bit to pick up my food, and had to wait an extra minute for the guy at the take-out counter to notice me.  I initially thought he was using a handheld device to manage orders as servers sometimes do, but then realized after getting a better look at the screen of the device that it was actually a phone and he was chatting with somebody.  I was annoyed but let it go, only to get home and realize that I got the wrong salad dressing.  Thanks a lot for that.  Perhaps the management needs to have their employees leave their phones under lock and key in the back of the restaurant so they can better concentrate on working.

I'm giving it a 1 star because that is the lowest I can give it.... This place just sucks..... We were seated and literally waited for like 10 minutes before we were even greeted... We never got bread.... The beer took like 5 minutes... And he kept pressuring us for food.... Before we even got our beer.. I am a frequent diner at cpk... But I will never return to this location.

One of the best meals I've had in a while! I ordered the roasted garlic chicken + seasonal vegetables and it didn't disappoint. I honestly couldn't fault. The customer service was excellent and the wait time wasn't too long at all. Would definitely return.

I'll have to agree on the negativity of this particular CPK. I've eaten here a couple times, and had their food for work meetings about once a month.  The first time I've had food from this CPK was through delivery to work for a meeting. My food was alright, but there was hair in two of my co-worker's food.  Second time.. delivery again. Hair in another co-worker's food.  Other times... they seem to forget when we ask for "extra of something," but when we ask to omit something, they tend to get that correct. Cheap, much? o.o Oh, they also skimp out on the full sized salads too. I was sad. The service has been around the same both times I've eaten at this CPK. A different person would come to our table each time, and the food took a while. No full bar, etc. It seemed a bit odd in there, but the food was okay. No hairs, so yey?

I am an avid lover of California Pizza Kitchen and this location does an excellent job of maintaining the quality and deliciousness that I would expect.  Location: Located on San Vicente Blvd, lunch time can be an absolute Bi&*h when it comes to parking...especially if you just want to get take out which leads me to the next section!! Parking: It's a killer especially at lunch trying to find parking of any kind. They do have a parking structure which is nice if you are looking to dine in BUT if you are like me and have to do take out or curbside...good luck. The problem is most of the time there is someone parked in the passenger loading zone which makes it incredibly hard to get your damn take out! It's unfortunately that CPK hasn't realized that they should have the curbside parking in the actual parking structure...it would just make things move a lot more smoothly. Food: When it comes to the food you can't go wrong with anything...and the butter cake is an absolute must order if you haven't had it before. When I have time to sit and relax for a second i like to have the Carribean Sunset Sangria while I wait and especially with this heat it's refreshing and alcoholic so yay!!! Would i recommend you come here!!?? Yes of course just make sure to not bet on finding street parking during lunch hours and you will be fine!! Yelp 100 Challenge 2015 - 12/100

This is a really nice locations for a California Pizza Kitchen. It's honestly only the 2nd time I've been to this chain and my buddy told me their menu had completely changed. I just had half a salad and it was a lot of salad. I sat at the bar and watched them cook a lot of other food which definitely looked really good so I'll be back.

I like this place primarily because of their patio and location. Their food is okay. I like the bbq chicken salad and my wife and I share a pasta that we custom order. The challenge with this place is the service. I've called to order a pizza to go at 10pm last week, they close at 10:30pm on weekends. I was told they were no longer making pizzas. I asked if I showed up at the restaurant to eat would they turn me away? The hostess explained that I would not be turned away but said I could not place an order still. At that time I asked to speak to a Manager. The Manager immediately apologized to me and took my order. I picked up the pizza got home and order was wrong. I called the next day and my money was refunded and I was given a $30 gift card. I thought that was fair. Last night we went back and was greeted by a server who's first words out of her mouth were "what's your order" my wife and I looked at each other in shock and then looked at the server, said hello and asked how she was doing. She responded by saying "hi, good, I'll give you guys a few minutes". Had we not had the gift cards to use we would have walked out which I think she wanted us to do since it was 9:30pm. Management and ownership had better get their staff corrected or this place will fail. This place should be booming because of location and pricing but it's not.

wow! such a great experience. I had no wait time to be seated. My server was so attentive. The drinks showed up to our table before I could even start conversing!! wow such service is so hard to find.The main dish was served at such perfect time. Now on to the exquisite flavors the amazing blends of high quality spices and ingredients have made me a huge fan!   Thanks so much !!!

I won't be coming to this location anymore. Straight to the point, whoever manages the take out crew at this CPK needs to rehire. I don't expect the young adults behind the counter to 4 star service me but they lack even the most basics of proper service. They don't acknowledge you until you have to interrupt them. And then when you do that, they treat you like crap. They just throw your food on the counter and you have to put your food in the bag yourself. It's like you're the thorn in their side They're rude, especially the girl with the glasses, I believe her name is Miranda.

I came here for lunch and found free street parking a couple of blocks away. We sat outside on the patio (the restaurant is upstairs so you have to go up the escalator to get there) which was nice. The server was very nice and helpful. The food was pretty good, though nothing special. I didn't feel well after that lunch...can't say for certain if it was something in the food. Wish they had more lunch options on their menu!

I've been coming here for two years with my kids, and this place is such hit or miss with service.  I was in there last weekend, I noticed a new manager and new waitstaff.  Placed my order for me and my kids,  waited 30 minutes and inquired as to what was taking so long,  kids pizza and Mac and cheese should not take that long.  As it turns out the kitchen lost or misplaced my ticket.  Kids food finally come out 15 minutes later, (we are there an hour at this point). And I still do not have my dinner.  At that point I had to cancel my order, my kids were done and started to fade.  I complained to the manager and he gave me a $15 gift card.  Great, except for the fact I will probably never go there again.  This was just one example of bad service here,  I know many people that have had similar experiences.  I give it to stars instead of one because the food is not bad when you get it.

Wow. Just wow. I've never eaten cheese balls so cheesey, so creamy, yet so mild in flavor. An almost undetectable note of cheese, I dipped my finger in the overhandedly sumptuous sauce more than once.  I went with a couple of girls and my man. I ordered the spaghetti with extra garlic, which they didn't put in therefore I had to ask for a side of garlic after my spaghetti had already matured.  My own girlfriend ordered the truffle butter surprise, aka the mushroom pizza with eggs and truffle sauce aka the "ol spongeous fungus".  We ordered cheese balls for dessert, with extra balsamic vinegar.  Xoxo, gossip man
Kristen was great! She was so nice and friendly, pretty funny too. Food was great as always, I had the Chinese chicken salad.

This CPK location has been there for as long as I remember and is always packed during the earlier dinner times with parents and their younger kids. For appetizers, I enjoy the spinach and artichoke dip here as well as their tortilla spring rolls.  For pizza, I usually order anything thin crust. I used to love their tostada pizza which is basically a mini salad on top of a pizza. I also enjoy their Sicilian pizza too.  For salad you've got to go with the famous BBQ chicken salad. Their Italian something Cobb salad is not bad either.  For dessert, head down to yogurtland or coral tree or anywhere else near by for something worth the calories!

Delivery: 1 hour late. Hummus tasted like straight lemon. Spinach dip tasted like the sour cream or whatever sauce that was used had gone bad. Pepperoni pizza was cold but otherwise tasted okay. Won't do delivery again. Much yummier eating in or picking up.

Despite the reviews that made me afraid, I ordered online for the CPK in brentwood and  did curbside pickup. I ordered at 7:15PM on Saturday night and picked it up at 7:45. The parking garage was convenient and the valet pointed me (when I asked) to a spot very close to the escalator. The people inside CPK were friendly and processed the order correctly (had a few mods) and I was on my way in 5 minutes! No parking fee or anything so huzzaha

You can never get wrong with your choice from their menu. Love their food! Good family place. Sometimes too crowded because of too many kids running around.  My husband and me love their choice of pastas and salads. We love to sit outside and enjoy nice San Vicente Blvd view from the 2nd floor. We brought there our friends from New York and they liked CPK.

A scold, and a bug. We went with a party of kids , 5 little boys and their parents. They put us in a corner, and just behind the overexcited kids, installed four quiet and judgmental  ladies.  Bad, bad setup. The kids were not running around or acting dangerous. Just overexcited and maybe loud, but ...no less than the parents. I have seen louder people in  chic restaurants. The ladies complained and someone came  and scolded the kids, frightening them.  If you want to complain, you have to talk to the PARENTS. It's not ok to come and frighten 6 years old little boys. Nope. I am here for that if there is a problem. And I am responsible  enough to act on it, thanks. You are not allowed to talk to my kid without my permission, and certainly not allowed to scold him. This is a total no-no.  Then we came back home, and a few hours after the kiddo was sick with a stomach bug and vomiting. Since I am strict with hygiene at home and made him wash his hands before going to the restaurant, my guess is he caught it there... A scold and a bug, what a nice party!
My favorite place to eat. Been coming here since I was a kid and terry is the best server in the world service is one of a kind. Everyone is so friendly.

My wife, daughter, and I came here  4 outdoor lunch patio. We came with her dog who is very well behaved. The manager brought a bowl of water for the dog which was incredibly thoughtful. I ordered a half portion of the BBQ chicken salad. My wife had have one of the Italian chopped salad. My daughter went with the caramel peach salad. Despite the fact that I had a half portion salad, it was more than enough to leave me completely filled. My salad had a generous amount of chicken and a good amount of chips. My only criticism would be that the salad came with a little too much BBQ sauce on it. The next time I will order it with a barbecue sauce on the side, then add the amount that I think is appropriate. My wife the half order of the Italian chopped salad. The meat in the salad was cut in very thin strips allowing you to enjoy the flavor without being overwhelmed and also avoiding the extra extra calories. Overall a very enjoyable lunch.

Okay folks... we have ourselves another dog friendly restaurant here - YAY! I must say that the evening service here is so much better than the lunch service. I've never reviewed CPK before and I don't know why but last night the service and food were both great. We split a BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad and the Pear & Gorgonzola Pizza. The salad was decent but very little chicken and BBQ taste or dressing but the pizza was off the hook good. My usual fave is the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza (and it is still one of the best on their menu) but someone turned me onto this Pear & Gorgonzola and OMG it's so delish! Surprisingly there were a several tables with young children at them out on the patio. My dog was more well behaved than they were as was another pup on the patio. I take control if my pup gets a little hyper while out and I wish more parents these days would do the same. I could never get away with that crap when I was a kid!!! Anyways... luckily we finished just as a large party with lots of very loud wee ones arrived. Absolutely nothing against kids folks.... just parent them. :) Everyone deserves to have a nice dinner out.

Yeah it's ok. It's another California Pizza Kitchen. You've been to one, you've been to them all.  This place is located in Brentwood on San Vincente. Lunch time and rush hour the traffic in this area is awful. They do validate parking though so you can park in their garage which is helpful. The neighbor hood has several coffee and desert places to try out afterward if you like to stroll.  I gave it 3 stars because it's California Pizza Kitchen. They all get 3 stars.

Ordered the BBQ chopped salad... Half size... More than filling and very good. The pinto beans threw off the balance a bit, but it was saved when getting some sweet corn. It is odd it came with the lime... If you use it, the flavor becomes unbalanced. Odd choice in my opinion. Service was great and the price you pay is comparable to the food you receive.  If you have a chance, ask for Kaitlin, always smiling and concerned about your experience at this CPK.

Did you know that a CPK salad has about the same number of calories as a CPK pizza?  We sat there in shock when we saw the new menus with calorie information.  Unless you order half of a salad, basically anything you order off the menu will have at least 1,000 calories.  You can even splurge on the Thai crunch salad, which has over 2,000 calories.  While it was a bit discouraging to find out how many calories are in each dish, everything tasted delicious as always.  I was delighted to find out that my favorite Portobello Mushroom Ravioli was on the light side for pastas.  On top of the great food, service was fabulous today.  We had a party of 10 and all received our food within 15 minutes of ordering.

Ugh, such a disappointment. I love CPK. Yes, I know it's a chain restaurants, but they have great salads and a growing menu. But, can I just tell you that this was by far, the WORST CPK I've ever been to. Located in the upscale neighborhood of Brentwood, you'd think they'd provide five-star service. Instead, we got shitty, horrible service.  A few complaints: - Isn't it common sense to clean the table of appetizer plates before you serve the main dish? I guess there servers didn't get that memo. - Usually servers are supposed to refill your drink without you having to ask three times - RUDE and SNOTTY servers. I believe her name was Athennia or something like that? Don't ever let that little red head serve your - she is a complete snot. All the other servers were the exact same way. - I also heard complaints from my table about their food being cold. - They changed their red velvet cake - sadness. Highlights: - Honestly, none. The most exciting part of this CPK experience was on the way to the restaurant and driving by OJ and Nicole Simpson's old house. Hopefully you have a better experience - or better yet, don't EVER go here if you enjoy good service.

Love the food but they miss something in almost every take out order. We are vegetarians and almost everyone order has meat on it even though we ordered the items without meat. Not cool to spend $100 everytime and not be able to eat...they did offer to remake the food, but who wants to drive back another 30 minutes to get what was supposed to be received the first time correctly. We have never had an issue at other CPKs, so I am assuming it is just the casual environment from this management team at Brentwood location...

We love the food, but getting it delivered or picked up is a nightmare.  I have had three straight negative experiences with this place.  First, we ordered through LABite.  After it was delivered they forgot to include the greens to top the pizza, which is the main part of the taste.  LABite blamed it on the restaurant, the restaurant blamed it on LABite.  We were told they would not bring it out, nothing either of them would do.  That was the last time we ordered CPK from LABite.  The second problem came a couple of weeks ago.  We decided to give CPK another chance, ordered on line and when my son showed up to pick it up at the time we were told, they said there was no order.  After five minutes he was told there was an order, but they has misplaced it.  Two nights ago, we decided to try again, ordered on line, and given a pick up time of 7:56 for curbside pick up.  He gets there and while waiting for the food to come out, he was constantly harassed by the valet guys for taking up their space.  After 1/2 hour the food arrived and got he home around 45-55 late.  I called the "manager" Kelli, and after explaining our complaint that night and the past problems, all she did was make excuses and blamed us for their mistakes.  When I told her about the LABite problem, she accused me of lying, and said that could never have happened.  Getting nothing but rude lip service from her, I asked her to have the corporate office call me the next day so I could lodge a complaint with them.  Still waiting for that call. The food is great (I would give it 4 stars), but not worth the hassle of dealing with incompetent and rude apathetic people.

Inconsistent and bad management. You never know what you're going to get on any given day and that includes if you'll even get an item as described. Best to avoid during the weekend, their busiest time.
One word. BBQ CHICKEN PIZZA  OK, 3 WORDS.  With strawberry lemonade. I m happy camper

This CPK has more kids than the Westwood location, but despite it being Brentwood, I've never had a problem with the kids misbehaving, unlike Pitfire pizza. You can sit inside or out( heat lamps are a godsend), and the service is good. CPK is good, basic, reliable food. Everyone can find something they like, from the dumplings, to the pastas, salads and pizzas and the yummy desserts. I am lactose intolerant but will brave it for their sundae with the dark rich fudge that hardens on contact with the vanilla ice cream.  Parking is underground and cheap with validation. you can order online and pick up, but if you have special requests these can get messed up. in person no problems. CPKs do vary by location, this one and the Westwood one have good food. I tend to go here because the parking is better, even though the Westwood one is closer to me.

Went here for my mother in laws birthday. They sat 14 of us on a Sunday night pretty quickly and they don't even take reservations. Great service, great food and really good atmosphere (surprisingly) for the kids. We have 6 nieces and nephews so keeping them occupied is a struggle. All in all it was a success!

Something has changed in the kitchen as nothing tasted as before and almost everything we ordered was way below average (even a simple pizza).  No wonder the place was so quiet on a Sunday when everywhere else in the neighborhood was packed.  Food was horrible but service still good!

One of the worst dining experiences of my life. Poor service, dirty restaurant, terribly burnt food and out of everything. When we first arrived they said it would be about a 20 minute wait.  While we were waiting, I overheard a waitress laughing that she had given food to the wrong table.  That was my first hint that dinner may not go smoothly.  Another party walked in and asked how long it would be and it seemed like the hostess was trying to say anything to get them to leave.  She kept saying - it's going to be a wait, the servers are really busy and trying to catch up.  I was pretty sheocked and how unprofessional and sad it was that they are so overwhelmed they are trying to get people to leave. Now if you've been there before, you know that it's a really dark restaurant.  Well we were seated at a table where the few light bulbs that existed above were all out.  I could barely see my menu (and i couldn't see my food at all when it arrived).  The tables next to us were empty, but completely dirty.  I've never seen a restaurant with so many empty, dirty tables before. I ordered a sprite and the waitress said "sorry we are out of sprite" Really?.  My father ordered a beer.  When the waitress brought our drinks, she clearly brought a different beer than what my father had ordered.  When asked, the waitress said they were out of the beer he ordered and she had brought a different one.  She barely knew the name of the beer she brought us and couldn't tell us if it was a wheat beer or not.  My father is allergic to wheat.  So after a google search of what the beer was, of course it was a wheat beer.  She wasn't even going to mention it was a different beer-- we had to figure out whether it would make my father sick or not.  For dinner, I ordered a Chicken Caesar salad and the waitress said "I'm sorry we are out of parmesan cheese." A pizza place is out of cheese? Really? After a long wait, finally our food arrived.  The chicken in my salad came black and inedible.  The salad maybe had a small drop of dressing on it-- the salad was pretty much dry.  I couldn't even tell what salad they were trying to make.  It was really upsetting that we had to pay for this food, but I didn't want to make a scene when we were trying to have a nice family dinner. At the table next to us, a family with two small children were eating.  I overheard that the mothers meal also came black and burnt and inedible.  The waitress offered to remake it for her, but she said no thank you because their food took so long to come and the children needed to go to bed. My family and I decided-- as we love CPK-- we will never come to this location again.  Thanks but no thanks.  I can't believe such a popular famous restaurant could operate like this.

Worst service ever. Waited for 5 min at the front to be greeted at the front, tons of ppl passed me bye, however no one would help me.  Once someone did help me, he was rude &  there was another customer complaining about the service & how long it took for a simple order, & the manger didn't even apologize!  Never again!

The food is good when you dine in, but delivery is very iffy. Sometimes I've received bunt chicken and the portions are very small for what you pay for. Some of the staff there are amazing like them woman who greets you, and there is a FANTASTIC SERVER. I can never remember his name but he is super tall and just so polite and funny. I'm pretty sure it is Scott. Other than those two... I have experienced some very rude workers. It's sad because CPK is one of my favorite places to go to, but I stray away from this one unless my favorite server is there. Just not worth being treated poorly.

I just wanted a dessert coming back home from a hospital visit. I don't know why ordering to go has to be an ordeal specifically dealing with the employee name Chester. There were no greetings of hello, how are you. I have to ask for a menu. He has to say "so you want to order?" The interaction was so unpleasant. Obviously he doesn't want to be there. I have to wait for 15 minutes for a dessert and a rootbeer. I thought someone else was going to bring it. As it turned out it would be him and he made me wait that long while he was prioritizing the pick up/delivery orders. He ended up taking care of my order until maybe a supervisor was wondering if he had helped me. While he was taking care of it he had to stop and drop it and take care of another delivery pick up order. Once he handed my order there were no thank you, sorry for the wait. He just said here you go. That whole thing made me feel very icky. I don't know why it has to be such an ordeal.

I think my husband and I have been dining here once a week.  They've spiffed up their menu and, for the most part, it's been pretty consistently good here.  We choose to sit at the bar and the service up there is hit or miss.  Yes, even at the bar when the server is right in front of you.   My husband likes the chicken and pasta with capers and the garlic chicken.  He also likes the cheese pizza.  I jump from the jambalaya pasta to the steak to the tacos.  All are tasty!   Bottom line, this is a very family friendly place so expect a lot of screaming kids.

Too bad this place can't be given 0 stars. Ordered chicken piccata. Crispy chicken doesn't mean burnt chicken! The pasta was over cooked & dry! They didn't put any sauce on the chicken & pasta. The lady at take out counter needs to learn how to treat customers. They changed most of the staff & it's gone from bad to worse!

CPK Brentwood's service and food is superb! I especially want to thank Scott for staying past his shift to serve our table and make sure we had an excellent experience! Thank you so much for going above and beyond to satisfy your customers :)!

If you do come here, SIT OUTSIDE. The views of the busy streets & city lights will accompany your meal perfectly. However, it took a grand total of about 35 minutes just for ONE pizza ( 1/2 cheese  1/2 veggie). They do get busy, so it's best to RSVP. However, the quality of the cheese and the veggies did not exceed my expectations, it is pretty average. There are better pizzas with fresher & realer ingredients worth the few extra bucks. The service was good and so was the atmosphere. Food quality: 3/5

Constantly order from this location to-go and Postmates... never had an issue until tonight. Found multiple pieces of hair in my chicken piccata :( Never had any complaints about the food or service but this is absolutely disgusting.
Great food. Nice clean restaurant and kitchen. Nice staff. Love curb side pick up.  We order for pick up or eat at the restaurant all the time.

I ordered my lunch through postmates and was very pleased with my food. I ordered the lunch duo half chicken club sandwich and baked potato soup. Everything was delicious! The chicken was tender, the bread was soft, potato soup was so flavorful and creamy and they send 2 little pieces of baguette which were still warm and soft too. I cannot wait to order something else next week, in fact I think I will have to get my boyfriend to take me there for dinner tonight. Lol

My family and I go to CPK quite often. It is our go-to restaurant for birthdays, anniversaries, holiday dinners-- you name it! Needless to say, we love the food! The BBQ Chicken pizza is top-notch!!  This CPK in particular is one that we are not so fond of. It seems that we almost always get horrible service here. We came here on the fourth for a family dinner and we were less than pleased with our waitress. We understand that nobody would work on the fourth if they do not have to, but we still expect DECENT service. This woman wanted us out... and immediately.  We did not get bread and butter like we normally do at our local CPK. Upon asking for it, the waitress said that they do not have any more bread. Ok, reasonable-- they ran out.  Next we asked for refills for our drinks. She told us that they had turned off their soda fountain. Alright... why would you do that if we are still here? Or better yet, why did you take us in.  To top it all off, she did not even offer a desert menu. We had to ask for one and when we ordered the butter cake, she said that they had turned their ovens off. Icing on the cake. (No pun intended)

This is my favorite California Pizza Kitchen. Some of my best memories growing up are coming here on Sundays with my family and eating outside. They have a valet service in the parking lot, which is okay. Though, I am against paying for parking. But the plaza overall seems to be pretty great. The CPK looks modern and it's fun to sometimes stand on the bridge and enjoy the scenario while waiting for our food to come. The waiters are nice and there are a lot of options to choose from. The food is also pretty good, a bit pricey. But nothing too out of line. Overall, its a great CPK and I would definitely coming here.

I'm surprised I haven't reviewed this location before. I think I just assumed I had, we've eaten here so many darn times. Let's say, conservatively, 10 meals have been consumed at this location, and probably 90% of them have been take-out. They have curbside service, which is HUGELY helpful, as anyone who knows the area knows how busy San Vicente is at all hours of the day. There's a loading zone, and you can just swing in there with your emergency flashers on and a CPK employee will run the food downstairs to your car. Tip the poor soul, won't you? The food is always reliably decent-to-good. It's CPK. It's not going to blow your mind, but they generally have somewhat impressive combinations of foods that are tough to mess up.

Really, there should be better options to eat in the area but somehow we ended here. Service was ok, not stellar really. They seemed more distracted. My husband had the meat pizza and said it was nothing special, pretty small for I think just under $15. My salad was pretty good, but not healthy in the least. The salads have more fat, calories and sodium than most of the other menu items here, so as long as you are not tricking yourself into thinking you are doing something good for yourself, you're fine. It was ok, again nothing special. Overpriced for the quality, no real thought or care put into preparing or presenting the food, I would not bother to be back.

By far the slowest and understaffed Cpk in USA. They live off Santa Monica location. If they make any mistakes on your big meals they can only offer$20 gift card, like that makes up for time and energy and ambarrassment of how slow they begin to even attend to you. They this line is "I'll be right with you " when they come back in about 15 minutes. We wish they had better servers since the cooks food is good.Bad management in action. At Xmas, they do not take in account HANAKKUH or Atheists. They overwhelm with Xmas music like that's smart idea anymore. No specials at Cpk CORPORATION...they just want you to empty your pockets in their till.  Family restaurants are supposed to have some specials other than unhealthy kid meals.

Oh my goodness what a great location on the second floor of a cool area of Brentwood even though Brentwood has a lot of plastic surgery and fake rich people this place screams good food good employees good everything. I love the crispy thin pizza and the barbecue chicken salad is driven wow. Also catch a view of all the silly silly silly people in Brentwood man it's just how life is not real in the real world I caught a woman ask a man if he knew where her poodle could get a facelift oh my goodness anyway back to the restaurant these guys know what they're doing it's a great place get the cheesy macaroni cheese is so good also the dumplings are great and the pasta is out of this world you got to try it thanks California pizza kitchen you're the best

Absolutely horrible service if you are with a delivery platform such as Doordash or Postmates. They ignore you, don't get your orders out in anything that resembles a timely manner and argue with you if you ask for basic extras such as parm cheese or napkins. If you are a customer, I wouldn't recommend ordering from this location

Too much hot spice and pepper on food. I'm sick of California cuisine adding hot spice to everything. So low brow and boring. This place is good except for hot pepper in BokChoy and in too many items.

Why I'm never eating at the CPK on my street anymore - I eat at CPK 1-6 times a week for the past 7 years. I am soooo irritated with the Brentwood location. Four days ago my food was carelessly prepared and I got food poisoning. (Fool me one time shame on you) the manger said he would call to check on my blah blah blah. He never called. He said no one else got sick. Soooo I'm like okay are you guys targeting me for the runs? They said they are sending me a gift card (how is that a gift?) then like an idiot I went back two days later and they were super unaccommodating. I asked for pineapple juice and orange juice mix and they refused saying it's not on the menu. So okay whatever. I order a thin crust artichoke spinach pizza with pepperoni. It comes out undercooked, soggy, ugly and with only 5 pepperonis on it. I ate the 5 pepperonis off and bit the pizza it was awful. Awful. They have fell off the map and the food is gross. They don't put any effort into what they are doing and don't have a true love for what I'm ordering. I'm never eating Cpk again. They disgust me. It's very depressing too because that the place I eat at most. When I explained my disdain and even food poison to the management they should have either remade my food or refunded me. Clearly o wasted my time and money. What would make me ever so happy would to mail them this pizza Back with my receipt and see a refund for the last two times I wasted my money there.

CPK has always been the place for the reasonably priced healthy salad. However today I realized they have a new menu. The price of salads have Increased Significantly. The chicken is now considered an add on for an additional $4.50. Bringing the price up to approximately $18.50 for a half size salad. Way Too expensive for me.  I decided to order a pizza. I looked all over the menu and found the pizzas hiding under a fold down flap. The other entrees are priced above $22.00.  The service is always excellent but the prices are beyond my budget.  Check out the screenshot of the salad menu.

This is one of few locations of CPK I like to hangout. I love their outdoor seating you are overlooking San Vicente.  I always ask for Pizza. They had new thing called Shrimp Scampi Pizza which is housemade lemon-garlic shrimp with caramelized onion, Mozzarella, Parmesan and red chili, topped with fresh arugula and wild Greek Oregon, and it was delicious just like its name.  I asked for their freshly puréed pineapple & cucumber with monin cucumber, fresh torn mint and agave sour, topped with club soda it was refreshing and tasty. Our waiter was very nice and he kept checking on us.

When this restaurant chain opened it was terrific. After selling out to a big corporation food has slid in quality!  Sometimes things go just right: Salmon dinner with corn, carrots and other veggies great mildly spicy flavor great, fish cooked just right. However, About a month ago the fish was so dry we had to find a sauce in our cupboard to eat it. Dinners, NOT chicken on top of Pasta are better. Salads are ALWAYS great order the whole as half is only a third..use the extra to share or for next day. BEST Thai cruncb, BBQ Chicken, Moaccan. Dunplings!!! Best thing on the menu, otder a side of sauce ?tasty) Their dumplings are better thsn even good chinesd restaurantd Pizzas hae gone down, only a tiny bit of  cheese & sauce. Some have cold ingredients that make the pizza chilled. Best are Thai chicken, multiple kinds of mushrooms (you can add chicken), and original BBQ Chicken. All are skimpy with cheese, how mucb could it cost? REALLY MISS YHE CRAB CAKES! Try other places for these. Even buy them at Gelsons for an easy home meal.

Everything I ordered was delicious.  Started with the Dakota pea and barley soup, then the arugula and asparagus salad, then the salted Carmel pudding.  Enjoyed it all.  Didn't realize that they had more than pizza on the menu.  Will return for sure...
Great spot in Brentwood for a casual and reasonably priced dinner. My wife and I love coming here for a spur of the moment date night. Parking can be a little tough, but otherwise awesome experience!

I love coming to this CPK because the service is good and I love their salads.  Last time my friend and I went we had an exceptionally friendly and thoughtful waitress, Esther.  She brought us bread fresh from the oven because it was cold outside and did other little things that made us both feel well taken care of.  This particular restaurant can be a little loud with kids but overall I've never had a negative experience here.

Hanging out in Brentwood again. I found a dish that I really like at CPK. The strozzapreti pasta with mushrooms, a very uncommon pasta that you rarely see on menus. I use to get it when my aunt made it for me growing up. Their food overall is very good and consistent. For a chain restaurant they've done a great job in creating a fresh high quality restaurant. I've had many items on the menu from their pizzas to their pastas and salads. The chicken piccata and the strozzapreti are my favorites. Their salads are very fresh as well. Who ever is developing their recipe knows what going on. The service is always good and they offer a take out as well. They also have a curb side service they offer as well. Which is cool just pull up and they hand off your dinner. It's a great location with convenient parking underground which they validate. The best surprise is the great desserts. Considering they are a pizza salad place their dessert are very good ! That have a great pumpkin cheesecake for the holiday season. Good stuff !

My favorite California Pizza Kitchen! Outdoor seating, overlooking San Vicente. Good for a casual date night, people watching etc. They also have indoor seating. Great menu elections of various pizza. The service was great! We came at night shortly before close but they were still hospitable and gave us seating. The food and drinks were delicious! We will be back. We walked to avoid parking but there is parking garage next to it.

The food was good, but then CPK is always good. The service at this location could be better. Our server seemed mildly annoyed at basically anything I'd ask. She offered bread and I asked if it could be warmed up (since I know they usually give you cold bread, and it is much better heated). This isn't normally a big deal at all, but she paused and reluctantly said yeah. There were a few other little things like that. It didn't ruin the evening or anything, but this location is definitely lacking the awesome service component every other CPK I've been to has nailed.

Always very easy to get a table, and never packed (unlike the SM one!) The servers are always friendly and attentive, and the menu has a pretty wide variety of food. I usually get the BBQ chicken pizza or the chopped salad. It's upstairs in this outdoor shopping plaza, and has indoor and outdoor seating. Valet parking underneath in the garage.

Showed up to pick up an order placed online. The counter girl Lisa was very nice. The manager Alex on the other hand was extremely rude. I showed up and ask for my order, he said they were waiting for one item. I commented that the order was due approx 20 minutes ago. The manager Alex told me that they lost it and he didn't know what I wanted him to do. He was very rude considering I asked politely and was just curious why the order was not ready yet. I literally did not complain at all and he just told me I don't know what you want me to say instead of apologizing for their mistake.

CPK, I think it's fair to say that nearly everyone is familiar with that acronym. That of course bodes well for any company including a now stalwart chain like California Pizza Kitchen. For the most part you know what you are getting and you know the menu and a ballpark of what you are going to spend.  Again, all good things but also the type of normalcy that may have you overlooking a place like CPK . I am usually pleasantly reminded of how good their food and dining experience can be. This location also has patio seating and that stretch of San Vicente in the 90049 can make for a great spot to have lunch.  The service at this location is very professional and attentive.  Hey those actors have to start somewhere. The lunch duos consists of several choices. Select 7" Pizza's or sandwiches combined with a soup or salad.  I opted for the following and it was the perfect sized lunch, well prepared and "hit the spot" good.  THE ORIGINAL BBQ CHICKEN PIZZA  Created by CPK  in 1985. BBQ sauce, smoked Gouda, red onions and fresh cilantro.   SUPER SPINACH + QUINOA Crisp Granny Smith apples, marinated cranberries and spiced pecans with our house made Champagne vinaigrette. For the uninitiated, parking on that stretch of Blvd. can be a pain, just a heads up. I will surely not hesitate to return to this CPK or another for that matter.

A couple of us went for lunch to send off a co-worker for her last day with us.   :( Lunch wasn't as anticipated, due to servers.    I reached out to the CPK and  Manager, Anthony Reyes contacted me.   After him looking into the situation, he truly stepped up to the plate and made things right for the people in our farewell lunch.  Excellent customer service - way to go Anthony. "BIG" thank you from Rose

The staff is not helpful and we had to wander around to attempt to find some help even getting a table because apparently they are too cheap to have a hostess any longer. When I asked about table availability the waitress whom was printing a check up stated " I don't know " when clearly no one else was waiting and 5 tables were open.  Finally when seated the waitress was lovely and did apologize for our wait which is why there is 2 stars  It was a Friday night at 8 pm should be fully staffed

By far the worst service I ever had! I've been to this location twice, different waiters and I have received horrible customer service!! They don't check on you to see if you need anything else, and always rushing to do things. I understand they are busy at times but I see how they treat certain a people differently (the regulars) Never coming back!!!!

I like to sit at the bar and have a hot fudge sundae when possible and am delighted when Scott takes care of me. What a genuinely lovely fellow. So kind and respectful and such a nice personality. Thank you Scott!!!

Service was certified garbage. Came to get my takeout and the RUDE waitress literally snatched the money out of my hand, and then proceeded to count and give me my change in pennies out of spite. All for what? Well let me tell you... I brought this up to the manager and all he had to say was "Sorry, she had a bad day. We were really busy and it was raining hard." Seriously? Cry me a damn river while you're at it. No one has the right to be that emotional on the job unless you've just received news you've lost your job. Unfortunate for future customers, she probably still has hers. The pizza also tasted like grilled cardboard marinated in glue so I recommend you go somewhere else.

Probably one of the better establishments I've been to. This CPK is located upstairs to the left and sits on a pretty nice view of Barrington and San Vicente. It has a bunch of glass windows all around so scenically 10/10. The service was also great and fast. The server didn't hesitate to ask us questions and offered more sauce (for the avocado rolls). Speaking of the avocado rolls if you are a fan of chicken and avocados it's a must! The white corn guac and chips however is probably not worth the five dollars. You could probably get more at chipotle across the street.

One of my favorite CPK locations! It's upstairs and it has view over looking San Vicente. The interior is modern and formal creating that lounge atmosphere. Parking on the street or underground with validation.  I don't crave CPK that much but when I do it's mostly for their avocado rolls and tequila pasta! You can never go wrong with their avocado and their sauces (always ask for extra!!) I do believe that they need to give more than 6 pieces of avocado rolls in one order, it is a bit overpriced, but I still love it anyways! Check this location!
Food is decent but the smoke in here is unbearable.  How does the staff work in these conditions?

Had the Salmon a while back. Small  piece over cooked, with a tiny bit of cold corn and spinach mixed together for $20. The waitress never asked to refill the water. Not sure who owns this location. But they obviously care more about money these days, than good service and a good value of food quality versus price. The funniest moment was the hostess and another employee in a bit of conflict as to who was going to seat us. Used to go here when my kids were little. So sad that the food is so poor, overpriced and the staff is so lazy. Too many good restaurants around the area to put up with this!
Why 1 star because I ordered a Cobb salad has a hair,I showed it to our server name Scott and he just say sorry and wouldn't give us a credit.

I hate to support large chains like CPK BUT after years of trying a plethora of fish tacos from certified, stamped, and sealed "gotta try" spots to hole-in-the-wall eye sores, I (ahem) discovered a fish taco that speaks to my soul. Please "meet" the perfectly seasoned and sauced fish taco that upholds the integrity of ALL fish tacos to the highest standard. Perfectly battered with ripe avocados.  I think the fish tacos are the last item on the menu which is why it's often overlooked.

I just ordered a chicken ceasar salad for curbside pick up.  I had excellent service and came back to work with my delicious salad.  Thank you to all the employees that helped me.  They were very professional and and kind from start to finish.  Great experience.  I will eat here again.

Since this is a chain, I'm giving this rating completely based on service. Our waitress was extremely friendly, we had 2 comped entree + soft drink that we used and she was extremely helpful and even gave us a little extra at no charge. She was genuine which shows also.  I would recommend this CPK.

This happened a year ago about and hour or 2 before closing time. It was the weekend of my freshman year of college. I just came from the Santa Monica beach and was a little hungry. I chose CPK because it was nearby my college. When I got there, I felt disrespected that the waiters and greeters were treating me like a child. Was it because of my clothing? The way I acted? I was given coloring books when I first walked into the restaurant. The waiters went to the other tables that were seated right after me. It took almost a whole hour just to receive the meal.  I also asked 3 times for the check and waited another 45 minutes just for the waiter to finally give it to me. It may be almost closing time, but their service should still be top notch all the way to closing time.

Now that Cheesecake Factory is no more in Brentwood, we come to CPK instead.  This location is not that big but the food is good, the venue is clean, and the service is great.  Can't go wrong coming here for lunch or dinner.

Hi...I went to this CPK with my office for my Birthday lunch. We were quickly greeted at the door by a cute guy name Chris. He took us to our table and then quickly had us laughing as he told a joke. He ended up being our waiter and could not have been sweeter!! He was engaging and friendly and really made our dining experience memorable. Not only did he bring me a free birthday dessert, but he actually gave me a hand-made card with flowers and balloons in different colored ink and had my name on the front of this card!! He then had all the staff sign it with "Happy Birthday" sentiments!! It was the coolest thing ever and I realized that this is one special guy. His name is Chris Haynes, so please request him when you go here. He truly made it the best birthday lunch our office has ever had (and we've had a ton). I can't say enough about this awesome guy. Great server, with a great attitude!! Thank you CPK for employing this fine young man!! He's a gold-mine!!

I don't write reviews!!! I no longer can help but to write one tonight! The third time that CPK has messed up my order for pick up!!! Their device is horrible!!! I'm at home tonight and can't leave to get dinner and the manger ricky could careless!!! Just because you reverse the fee doesn't do it!!!  Please don't order food from them!!! Boycott CPK!!! Horrible service!!!

My boyfriend and I decided to go check out this location tonight since we were in the neighborhood, and I must say everybody at CPK was wonderful! Our pizza was great and the pumpkin cheesecake was to die for! Damian completely turned our whole day around and I couldn't be more grateful. Thank you guys so much for everything! We will be back!

I used to love this CPK location, but after a recent experience at the Brentwood location this all changed.  I  was with a few friends and ordered a few pastas and a pizza.  All of the pasta dishes tasted like gasoline, so we complained to the waiter.  The waiter then took a fork and stuck his grubby hands into the food and tasted it.  He claimed there was nothing wrong and that the food tasted great.  We sent the food back and re ordered to find that the pasta still tasted like gasoline.  We got the check and were surprised to see that we were charged twice for each of the dishes we sent back.  Long story short-- never going back.
CPK's pear and gorgonzola pizza (always ask for extra salad on top) will always go unmatched in my book. Also, they recently upgraded their starter bread, which is really much better.

Just enjoyed a lovely outdoor lunch at CPK. I was so hungry that I ate before I took a photo of my Sedona Tortilla soup. It was delicious! Thick and flavorful but not spicy. Perfect for me. It could have been a little warmer though. It came out lukewarm instead of piping hot although it could have just cooked quickly being outdoors.  I ordered the Roasted Vegetable salad to take home for dinner later.  The server was fast  and attentive, even offering water for the dogs, which I thought was a very nice touch.
Came here for dinner one night when I was working late. Service was good, prompt, and food was delicious as always. It's not very busy in the evenings as this is more of a business area.

You can never go wrong with CPK. The food is always great and the menu has so much to choose from. I ordered my meal Togo and it was waiting for me when I got there on time. It was really good too. My pregnant girlfriend was very happy with the timing and quality. Great job!

Another one of those places I take my three year old son in a pinch.  A big enough menu of "Americanized" Italian food.  I like the grilled vegetable salad with chicken which I order 90% of the time.  There pizzas are okay if you don't mind stepping outside of the box for traditional pizzas.  I think the pizzas improve if you order them on the thin crust rather than CPH's normal dough...they still are just okay, but better than the regular crust they use. I give the CPK in Brentwood four stars which is probably one star too much...but, I did so because the service when you sit at the counter is damn good.  There is a waiter named Scott who mans the take out  orders and the patrons at the counter, he has been a staple at this location for over 20 years.  Scott always remembers your name, what you like to eat and drink.  He is certainly an asset to this place.

I love CPK. Today I order avocado egg rolls for appetizer, really good. For lunch I had KUNG PAO SPAGHETTI with shrimp in hot red chilies sauce. My nephew ordered roasted artichoke with spinach  pizza with thin crust. I defiantly recommend this place for family :)

Won't be back.  Not worth the hassle and it took almost 15 minutes for a server to come by our table when there were only 4 tables seated with customers.  And, the only reason we got a server was because my daughter went to the hostess to ask her to get us a server.  The only plus side, our food came in 5 minutes.  Because it took so long to order, I opted not to eat.  It just took too long!

Okay... this gets a good review because of the customer service... AWESOME. So I went there to get TO GO food.  FOOD: *Garlic Chicken Pizza - always my favorite. I always get this. It's always good with WHOLE WHEAT crust :D Good size for two people or one really hungry person. * Iceberg lettuce salad - Yum.  * Mac N Cheese - their special fried ones that can be shared. Always yummy! SERVICE: Fast, cheap and easy. I left my bag (Halloween costume that my sister borrowed) and I didn't realize it til the next day. I was freaking out (that costume was expensive) and so I called them and told them I left my bag and they said they'd get back to me. And they did. They called and told me they had it and will keep it for me til I went. My sister went to get it for me (close to her home)... So service win! Lifesaver win. Overall: Always been a fan of the food... but the service won me over.  LOCATION: Near Third street and beach... WIN

Came here for a late lunch with a great friend of mine. The food was good, standard CPK. The service was ok, albeit a bit slow because it was an off time and not a lot of staff on hand. I forget this place is there because it is upstairs.  I do have to say I love the guacamole appetizer with the chips. It is really tasty. I had a basic pizza this day and it was good.
